opportunityFactors: Small firm (5-8 employees) ready for automation implementation
Specialized practice area with clear automation opportunities
Strict legal deadlines create automation value proposition
Serves both employers and employees (dual marketing angle)

automationAngle: Employment law firms operate with strict deadlines (180-day complaint windows), high documentation requirements for discrimination/harassment claims, and complex client relationships. With 3 attorneys handling everything from intake to settlements, manual processes create bottlenecks in client acquisition, case management, deadline tracking, and compliance. Automation can streamline the consultation intake, automate deadline reminders for EEOC filings, organize evidence collection, improve client communication, and automate billing - allowing the firm to grow revenue without proportional staff increases.

primary: Automated client intake and consultation scheduling
Employment law deadline tracking (EEOC, CRD, etc.)
secondary: Compliance reminder systems for federal/state laws
Marketing automation for both employment lawyers and employers

growthSignals.expanding: Case results in 2024 shown on website
growthSignals.newServices: Handles multiple employment law areas but no expansion signals visible
